page.title: 03FARMING IN LITTLE BADDOW
page.content: The main function of Little Baddow is a centre for the large surrounding agricultural area. The primary type of farming in the district is arable and a variety of crops, for example wheat, barley and rape are grown. Arable farming is best suited to this area, not only because of the light sandy soils but also the flat low lying land is suitable for the many new types of agricultural machinery available. More recently market gardening has developed in Little Baddow and orchards of apples and pears, and fields of peas and beans are a common sight. During the summer months there is an opportunity for the public to pick their own soft fruit. There is some dairying in the area because of the lush grass which grows on the alluvial soil of the river terraces.
